data.name: BBVA Home banking
description: I was part of a huge international team divided across various parts of Europe and America. We worked with agile methodologies, a combination of Scrum and Kanban, and followed best coding practices, mainly based on SOLID principles.
As a Frontend Developer, I assisted in designing complex features and played a significant role as a mentor for new team members.
The project was built using Cells, a client's proprietary framework. This posed the greatest challenge as there was no documentation, and we had to reverse engineer how Cells worked.

data.name: Starmeup
description: Starmeup is a team building tool that allows teammates to give feedback to each other.
As a Frontend Developer, I coded with Next.js and tested with react-testing-library. Additionally, I performed a refactor on legacy code to ensure code maintainability and readability.

data.name: Veracity
description: Veracity is an edtech marketplace. I started this project from scratch, defining the tech stack and providing guidance to the rest of the team to ensure a successful implementation.
I opted for the MERN stack because it comprises reliable technologies and the team already had experience with them.

data.name: Autosled
description: Autosled is an automotive transportation logistics platform and marketplace.
My role in Autosled was to refactor a lot of code smells and migrate old React to React v18.
The biggest challenge was detecting unused components and endpoints and deleting them without breaking the rest of the code.

data.name: Learn Programming
description: This project aims to help novice programmers learn the most sought-after skills in each stage of their careers.
I build Learn Programming with Ionic + React, and its only able for Android.
The biggest challenge was uploading the app to Google Play. I had to learn how to build and deploy using Android Studio, and I also learned Ionic from scratch. It was a very enriching project for me.
